channel.title: [Flash] Forms
channel.description:
[center][b][size=19pt] Ice Forms Tut V1 [/size][/b][hr] StepOne: Open Macromedia Flash and type in To - The email address destination for this email Subject - The subject of the email now To align the three text boxes in a pleasing manner, choose the arrow tool from the Tools window and drag a box completely around the three fields to select them. From the Modify menu choose Modify < Align < Right and Modify < Align < Distribute Heights. You should now have something like this: [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/thingy2342.gif[/img] Now we need to place three input fields to the right of our static text. Select the Text Tool from the Tools window and choose "Input Text" and enable "Show Border Around Text" in the Properties window. Drag an input field next to "To": and "Subject:". [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/thingylemon.gif[/img] now for the body do the same but were it says "single line" change that to "multiline". now line it up "Modify < Align < Left" To add scrolling to your large Body text input open up the Components window from Window < Components. Expand the user interface directory and scroll down until you see the UIScrollBar.Left click and drag the ScrollBar from the Components Window onto the right inside section of Body. Your text box should now look like this: [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/thingyorange.gif[/img]We have all the input fields we need to send an email, now all we need to name our inputs using Variables so that we can use the information the user inputs into our fields. Using the arrow tool select the To input field. Within the Proeperties window type in "to" as the Variable name like we have below: [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/thingyban.gif[/img] Repeat this step for the Subject field using "subject" as the variable and the Body textbox using "body" as the variable.
now it will send as a email! omg now we just need out send button ;) im using this simple button [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/send.gif[/img] you can use it to. just RightClick>SaveAs now add the button to the end of the form. you should have somthing like this: [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/end.gif[/img] now select the button with the arrow tool. We need to add a Flash Action so that this button will actually send email proprly. Open the Actions Window and navigate to Actions < Browser/Network < getURL. Double click getUrl to create the new action. [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/fformbuttonaction.gif[/img] now double click it [img]http://www.auto-rune.co.uk/images/fformactiongetURLblank.gif[/img] and now fill this in the following feild
* "mailto:" + to + "?subject=" +subject+ "&body=" + body
and check the Expression checkbox for URL.
